corpus_metadata.purpose: Train organism to develop entity-organ associations through consistent entity graph exposure
expected_outcomes: Emma → BOND/EMPATHY high, ventral state, V0 < 0.3
Lily → BOND/PRESENCE high, ventral state, V0 < 0.3
work → NDAM/AUTHENTICITY high, sympathetic state, V0 > 0.6

user_profile.name: Emiliano
user_profile.background: Engineering lead at tech startup, father of two young daughters, navigating work-life balance

daughters.name: Emma
daughters.context: Starting kindergarten soon, sweet and curious, loves hugs

daughters.name: Lily
daughters.typical_mention_context: safe, playful, parental care, bedtime routines

partner.name: Sofia
partner.context: Wife, co-parent, source of support and occasional tension
partner.typical_mention_context: relationship dynamics, shared parenting, connection moments

friends.name: Rich
friends.context: Childhood friend, grounding presence, outdoor adventures
friends.typical_mention_context: nostalgia, authentic connection, escape from stress

friends.name: Alex
friends.context: Work colleague who became friend, understands startup pressure

home.context: Safe base, family time, bedtime rituals

work_office.context: High-stress environment, deadline pressure, team dynamics

park.context: Weekend family time, Emma and Lily play

family_safe.description: Bonding moments with Emma, Lily, or Sofia

family_worry.description: Developmental concerns, parental anxiety about Emma's school, Lily's tantrums

work_stress.description: Deadline pressure, team conflicts, funding stress

relationship.description: Connection moments or tension with Sofia

conversations.input: Emma gave me the biggest hug this morning before I left for work. She said 'I love you daddy' and my heart just melted.
Lily was dancing around the living room tonight, completely unselfconscious and joyful. It reminded me what pure happiness looks like.
I'm worried about Emma starting kindergarten next month. She's so sensitive, and I don't know if she's ready for a full day away from us.
The deadline is in three days and we're nowhere near ready. The pressure from leadership is intense and I feel like I'm failing my team.
Another all-hands meeting about the funding situation. I can see the fear in everyone's eyes. What if we don't make it?
Sofia and I had a rare quiet moment tonight after the girls went to bed. We just sat together on the couch, not talking, just being. I'd forgotten how much I needed that.
I made myself go to the gym this morning even though I was exhausted. Twenty minutes in, I felt my body start to release some of this tension I've been carrying.
Bedtime with Lily tonight was so sweet. She asked me to read the same book three times, and I didn't mind at all. Her little hand in mine, trusting and warm.
Lily had a massive tantrum at the store today. Everyone was staring. I felt so helpless and judged. Am I doing this parenting thing wrong?
Alex pulled me aside today and said he's thinking about leaving. I don't blame him, but it would be such a loss. And it makes me question whether I should stay too.
Emma and Lily playing together at home. Hearing them laugh together is the best sound.
Emma smiled at me across the dinner table and it just filled my heart. These are the moments I live for.
Lily said the sweetest thing today: 'I love you to the moon and back'. My heart is so full.
Lily said the sweetest thing today: 'I love you to the moon and back'. My heart is so full.
Morning cuddles with Emma before a walk. These quiet moments together mean everything.
Morning cuddles with Lily before reading. These quiet moments together mean everything.
Morning cuddles with Emma before a walk. These quiet moments together mean everything.
Emma said the sweetest thing today: 'Can we do this again tomorrow?'. My heart is so full.
Lily asked me to read her favorite story again and it just made everything else fade away. These are the moments I live for.

training_notes.epoch_1_10: Exploration phase - organism sampling diverse responses, no strong entity patterns yet
training_notes.epoch_11_20: Pattern emergence - Emma/Lily → BOND/EMPATHY associations forming, work → NDAM/AUTHENTICITY emerging
training_notes.epoch_21_35: Consolidation - stable entity-organ patterns, cross-session consistency >80%
training_notes.epoch_36_50: Refinement - subtle context learning (Emma+school vs Emma+bedtime), co-occurrence patterns
